description: Numbers n such that there are equal numbers of 0's and 1's in first n digits of binary representation of Pi.
comments: Number of terms >= 10^k: 3, 6, 6, 129, 599, 777, ..., . - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 13 2009
links: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..777
mathematica: pir = RealDigits[Pi, 2, 10^6][[1]]; fQ[n_] := Count[ Take[ pir, 2n], 1] == n; 2 Select[ Range@ 3461, fQ@# &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 13 2009 *)
author: _Brian Galebach_
